tour-welcome: Hey, it looks like it's your first time here. If you like, I can give you a brief introduction. I recommend it, but if you prefer, you can skip it by clicking the 'x' button in the upper right corner of this modal.
tour-viewer-main: In this space, the different options of the app opens.
tour-split-button: With this button, you can split the main view into two. Try clicking it.
tour-viewer-active: The new view opens to the right and auto-selects. The active view has its top border fully visible, and any option selected in the app will load in the active view.
tour-resizer-container: With this central bar, you can resize the views.
tour-main-menu-button: Click to open the main menu.
tour-sidebar-actions: These are the options of the app. The icons with border open in the active view, and those without a border open in a modal.
tour-sidebar-localization: Try clicking the button to load the option in the active view.
tour-viewer-container-select: To change the active view, click on the view.
tour-dialogs-button: Try clicking the button to load the option in the active view.
tour-mode-button: You can toggle Modes(Online, Offline) with this button.
tour-tour-button: Click this button to open the menu of available tours.
tour-theme-button: You can toggle between light and dark theme with this button.
tour-settings-button: Click to open the settings menu.
tour-sidebar: Up to this point, the general interface has been covered. If you wish to continue with a detailed explanation of the configuration, proceed.
tour-settings-language: In this section, the language of the app and the language to be edited for the game, denoted as 'Origin Language,' are configured.
tour-settings-portraits: In this section, the directory of the portraits is specified. These are the images that will be used when displaying the preview of the dialogues.
tour-settings-libretranslate: In this section, the path and API Key of the LibreTranslate service (https://github.com/LibreTranslate/LibreTranslate) are specified. It requires you to either pay for the service or self-host it.
tour-settings-gemini: This section specifies the Gemini Api Key, the target translation language and the model to be used.
tour-settings-apprestart: With this button, you can delete all the information in the app — Use it with caution.
tour-finish: Good luck and thanks for testing the app.
tour-localization-01: Welcome to the Main Localization tour. In this walkthrough, you’ll get a general overview of the UI for this view.
tour-localization-02: Click here to open the main menu.
tour-localization-03: Click to open the Main Localization in the active view.
tour-localization-04: This is the default view when the page loads.
tour-localization-05: The Main Localization is divided into multiple categories. Use this ComboBox to select the category you want to load.
tour-localization-06: Categories are displayed as: Name [Number of translated keys / Total number of keys in the category].
tour-localization-07: This special category enables searching across multiple categories at once. Click on it to select.
tour-localization-08: Selecting the SEARCH category activates the search option.
tour-localization-09: You can search by text, translation, or key. Only one search type can be active at a time.
tour-localization-10: Let’s try searching by key. Type b0001 in the input field, wait for the table to load, then click Next.
tour-localization-11: This table shows the keys from the selected category or those that match the current filter.
tour-localization-12: You can filter by Original, Translation, and Translated values. Multiple filters can be active at the same time.
tour-localization-13: You can apply a regular expression (Regex) to update all values in the Translation column that match. Regex applies only to visible rows in the table. If filters are active, values outside the filter will not be modified.
tour-localization-14: Each row contains the Original, Translation, and Translated values.
tour-localization-15: This shows the original text for the selected source language. Hover to see the original values from other source languages.
tour-localization-16: Displays the key name and its category, visible only when the SEARCH category is selected.
tour-localization-17: Enter the translation that will replace the original value in the current source language.
tour-localization-18: Mark the key row as translated. Checking or unchecking saves the entered translation. If you change the translation but don’t toggle the checkbox, the change won’t be saved.
tour-localization-19: Translate all visible keys automatically using Gemini.
tour-localization-20: Uncheck all visible keys at once.
tour-localization-21: Check all visible keys at once.
tour-localization-22: Recalculate totals if they become out of sync.
tour-dialog-01: Welcome to the Dialog Localization tour. In this walkthrough, you’ll get a general overview of the UI for this view.
tour-dialog-02: Click to open the main menu.
tour-dialog-03: Click to open Dialog Localization in the active view.
tour-dialog-04: Dialogs are grouped into multiple categories. This is the category list.
tour-dialog-05:
Categories appear as: Name [Translated files / Total files].

You can rename a category by clicking its name.

To continue, click a category and then click Next.
tour-dialog-06:
This is a subcategory. It supports the same actions as a main category.
Click it to select it.
tour-dialog-07: Selecting a subcategory loads all its files.
tour-dialog-08: Use this to switch between files.
tour-dialog-10: Hover over each option to see a brief description of what it does.
tour-dialog-12: Here you can edit the dialog.
tour-dialog-13: Here you can change the dialog portrait, only if a portrait directory was set in the configuration.
tour-dialog-14: Here you can edit the speaker name. If propagation is enabled, all matching speaker names will update.
tour-dialog-15: Here you can edit the dialog text.
tour-import-translation-01: Welcome to the Import Translation File tour. In this walkthrough, you’ll get a general overview of the UI for this view.
tour-import-translation-02: Click here to open the main menu.
tour-import-translation-03: Click here to open the Import menu.
tour-import-translation-04: Click here to open Import Translation File in the active view.
tour-import-translation-05: Click or drag to import the DATA file. Wait for the upload to finish, then click Next.
tour-import-translation-06: Here you can see the different categories contained in the DATA file.
tour-import-translation-07: This section shows the records ready to be imported for the category you picked. By default, everything is selected. If you don’t want some of them, just uncheck their boxes.
tour-import-translation-08: Here you’ll find records that already exist in the tool. By default, they won’t be imported unless you check their boxes.
tour-import-translation-09: And finally, when you’re ready, click this button to start the import process.
tour-export-translation-01: Welcome to the Translation File Export Tour. This walkthrough will give you a general overview of the process.
tour-export-translation-02: Click here to open the main menu.
tour-export-translation-03: Click to open the Export option in the Active View.
tour-export-translation-05: When you’re ready to export, use this button to start the process.
empty_db: Its seem is your first time here, let's create all the necessary to begin the translation
dictionary-description: Words added to the dictionary will be highlighted in the Original text column with their corresponding translation
confirm-text-delete-word: I you sure you want to delete this word?
chapter-dialog-localization-description: All Story, Characters, Events, etc. dialogs texts
re-import-files-description: Update translation Database with new values
export-files-description: The moment of truth, try your localization
origin-language-description: The language to be replaced and saved when exporting the localization, please note that all languages have individual values, which means that all localizations made in a particular language are only for that language.
libretranslate-button-ready: Translate all dialog with Libre Translate
libretranslate-button-disabled: LibreTranslate its not configure or the server its not active, if you want use LibreTranslate click on gear icon(upper-right-corner) to configure.
gemini-button-disabled: Gemini its not configure, if you want use Gemini click on gear icon(upper-right-corner) to configure.
propagation-dialog-description-0: When editing, propagates the changes made to all
filters-localization-description: Only one filter can be active. Write on the filter you want to apply and wait 1 sec.
propagation-keys-description-0: When editing, propagates the changes made to all
propagation-keys-description-4: value, in the current language, applies to the Translation and Translated(checkbox) columns.
select-one-category: Select one category on upper left select Box
type-your-search: Type your search on results button
buffinfo-description: All records in the table can be used with the keyword | $BUFF:(ID) | ID must be changed by the table's Id values. The categories where it can be used are limited. As a general rule, only use where in the Original value is used.
order-hint: Order need to be more than 90000
obb-file-description: This file its located in directory → Android/obb/com.rayark.sdorica
drag-obb: Drag and drop OBB file here or
creating-main-groups-and-groups-descript: You can edit the names later if you want
name: Name
drag-localization: Drag and drop LOCALIZATION file here or
localization-process-complete-0: To apply the translation only replace your localization file with the new one, remember to make a backup, just in case you need
localization-process-complete-1: If the file downloaded have extension .txt remove it and it should work fine
localization-process-complete-2: The localization file will automatically been download if not
localization-file-description: This file its located in directory → Android/data/com.rayark.sdorica/files/imperium/localization
drag-gamedata: Drag and drop GAMEDATA file here or
gamedata-process-complete-0: To apply the translation only replace your gamedata file with the new one, remember to make a backup, just in case you need
gamedata-process-complete-1: If the file downloaded have extension .txt remove it and it should work fine
gamedata-process-complete-2: The localization file will automatically been download if not
gamedata-file-description: This file its located in directory → Android/data/com.rayark.sdorica/files/imperium/gamedata
not-support-mobile: Due to platform limitations, this file is not supported on a phone, use a computer.
translation-progress-description: Here you can see the percentage of the translation, it is advisable to save the percentages and compare the next time you come back here. The percentages are general.
translation-ui: UI: Menus, descriptions of objects, skills, characters, etc.
translation-dialogs: Dialogs: Main, characters and events story.
to-translate-description: It's time to translate, drag or click on the boxes at the bottom and provide the specified files, once done click on 'Apply Translation'.
to-share-description: If you want to share the progress of your translation, click the button below to begin the export process
obb-description: This file is located in the directory → Android/obb/com.rayark.sdorica
localization-description: This file is located in the directory → Android/data/com.rayark.sdorica/files/imperium/localization
gamedata-description: This file is located in the directory → Android/data/com.rayark.sdorica/files/imperium/gamedata
before-translation-apply-1: Don't forget to make a backup of the files to be replaced.
after-translation-apply-0: Important: If txt or any other extension was added when downloading the LOCALIZATION and GAMEDATA files, just delete the extension before moving them to their corresponding directory.
after-translation-apply-1: If the downloads did not start automatically, you can download the files by clicking on the 'Download' text in its corresponding box.
missing-files: Please provide all files to apply the translation
welcome-login: Welcome to the Sdorica translation tool, to continue log in.
can-not-login: Can't log in, try again later.
empty-db-guest: It seems you are too fast here, let the translators work a little more, come back later.
confirm-text-delete-gamevalue: I you sure you want to delete this value?
error-file-obb: The OBB file provided is not valid, verify that it is the correct file and try again.
error-file-localization: The LOCALIZATION file provided is not valid, verify that it is the correct file and try again.
file-skip-description: The file will be skipped in the translation process
alert-error-label: There was an error, please try again later
alert-wrong-file-label: The file provided is not valid, verify that it's the correct file and try again.
file-import-skip-description: File will be skipped when importing
error-file-gamedata: The GAMEDATA file provided is not valid, verify that it's the correct file and try again.
missing-files-import: Please provide all files to begin the import process
select-mode-description: Its seem its your first time here, select a mode to continue
api-connection-error: Cannot connect to the specified url. Please verify that the data is correct and try again.
import-description: Provide all the necessary files in their respective spaces and wait the import process to complete.
choose-languages-description: Select the language or languages you want to import, if you select more than one you must set one as default.
portrait-directory-miss-description: The directory specified in the configuration could not be found, please re-specify the directory
portrait-directory-miss-permission-descr: Missing permissions to access the portrait directory
lang-error: The new language could not be registered correctly, action omitted
main-groups-error: The new main group could not be registered correctly, action omitted
groups-error: The new group could not be registered correctly, action omitted
categories-error: The new main group could not be registered correctly, action omitted
keys-error: The new key could not be updated/registered correctly, action omitted
gd-categories-Error: The new category (GD) could not be updated/registered correctly, action omitted
gd-values-error: The new value (GD) could not be updated/registered correctly, action omitted
error-create-key: There was an error creating the key. Please try again later.
error-create-gamedata: There was an error creating the buff info. Please try again later.
error-file-data: The DATA file provided is not valid, verify that it is the correct file and try again.
app-restart-description: All information will be deleted, it is recommended to export your information to a file before proceeding.
regex-flag-g: Performs a global search, finding all matches in the text rather than just the first.
regex-flag-m: Changes the behavior of ^ and $ anchors to match the start and end of each line within a multiline text, in addition to the start and end of the entire text.
regex-flag-s: Allows the . (dot) character to match any character, including line terminators (like newline characters).
regex-flag-u: Enables full Unicode support, treating the pattern as a sequence of Unicode code points. This is important for correctly matching characters outside the basic Latin alphabet.
regex-flag-v:
An upgrade to u mode, offering more advanced Unicode features and set notation for character classes.
 (Note: u and v cannot be used together).
